snippet: A new ad featuring Big Bird was just one element of a broader effort by President Obama and his team to reassure supporters that his campaign had not lost its intensity or focus.
abstract: Obama campaign, hoping to raise morale following his lackluster debate performance, releases ad attacking Mitt Romney's promise to cut financing for PBS; ad, featuring beloved Sesame Street character Big Bird, gets a lukewarm reception from some Democrats.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Jim Rutenberg reported from New York, and Jeff Zeleny from Columbus, Ohio. Reporting was contributed by Michael Shear from Washington, Nicholas Confessore from New York and Helene Cooper from Columbus.

lead_paragraph: A new ad featuring Big Bird was just one element of a broader effort by President Obama and his team to reassure supporters that his campaign had not lost its intensity or focus.

headline.seo: Obama Campaign Tells Supporters: Steady On
headline.main: Obama Campaign Tells Supporters: Steady On
headline.print_headline: Message to Supporters From Obama Campaign: Steady On
